document_data.novels: [[Dragonwall (novel)|''Dragonwall'']];''[[Soldiers of Ice]]'';''[[War in Tethyr]]'';''[[Crucible: The Trial of Cyric the Mad]]''
document_data.mainbody:
===Gallery===
<gallery>
Dwarf1.jpg|''A classic depiction of a dwarf with a skullcap.''
Monstrous Manual 2e - Hobgoblin - p191.png|''A [[hobgoblin]] wearing a fur-lined skullcap.''
Kobold sword NWN.jpg|''This [[kobold]] is ready for battle with his spiked skullcap.''
Monster manual 1 - Goblin - p47.jpg|''An early depiction of a [[goblin]] in a horned skullcap.''
Dread warrior 2e.PNG|''A [[dread warrior]], ready to fight for [[Thay]] with his skullcap.''
Watchwall.png|''A [[skeleton]] in a horned skullcap moves to attack the [[Watchwall]].''
Bruenor batlehammer HL.png|''[[Bruenor Battlehammer]] sporting a skullcap.''
Naomlen caps WoW.png|''Examples of armored caps worn by dwarven [[rogue]]s as of the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].''
Emmeric.png|''[[Emmeric]] is ready to adventure into the ruins of [[Myth Drannor]] with his skullcap.''
Erek.png|''[[Erek]] sporting a horned skullcap.''
Jierdan sos 43.png|''The soldier [[Jierdan]] is ready to fight for [[Luskan]] with this spiffy skullcap.''
Yeslick - Baldur's Gate.png|''[[Yeslick Orothiar]] sports an impressive horned skullcap in the game [[Baldur's Gate (game)|Baldur's Gate]].''
Korgan - Shadows of Amn.png|''[[Korgan Bloodaxe]] shows in [[Baldur's Gate II: Shadows of Amn]] that horned skullcaps don't go out of style.''
She-wolves.png|''One of the [[She-Wolves]] of [[Ixinos]] outfitted with a skullcap.''
Tyrant.png|''Even a ruler like [[Tarnheel Embuirhan]] can see the value in a skullcap.''
Polyhedron-91.jpg|''A [[giant]] on the cover of [[Polyhedron 91|Polyhedron #91]] is ready for trouble with his skullcap.''
Battering ram 1e.png|''A group of humans decked out in skullcaps are determined to use their [[battering ram]].''
</gallery>

===References===
{{Refs}}
[[Category:Helmets]]
[[Category:Items from Faerûn]]
[[Category:Items from Toril]]
kv5irw14v0z0fnuyim0z8t82pyewy9d

Notable Wearers.Religions:
* The clergy of the [[Church of Tempus]] typically wore steel skullcaps in civilized areas untouched by war.<ref><ref>
* Members of the [[Knights of the Half Moon]] were outfitted with [[steel]] skullcaps tinted blue.
* [[Orb (priest)|Orbs]], [[specialty priest]]s in the [[Church of Iyachtu Xvim]], garbed themselves in iron skullcaps tinted black.<ref name="WaPotR-p83" >
